challenges.title: Hadrians Wall
challenges.description: A UNESCO world heritage site, Hadrians wall is a 73 mile path across northern England.

challenges.title: Great Wall of China
challenges.description: The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications that were built across the historical northern borders of ancient Chinese states and Imperial China as protection against various nomadic groups from the Eurasian Steppe.

challenges.title: Great Barrier Reef
challenges.description: The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system composed of over 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands stretching for over 2,300 kilometres over an area of approximately 344,400 square kilometres.

challenges.title: Wales Coastal Path
challenges.description: The Wales Coast Path is a designated long-distance trail which follows, or runs close to, the coastline of Wales. Launched in 2012, the footpath is 870 miles long and was heralded as the first dedicated coast path in the world to cover the entire length of a country's coastline.

challenges.title: Route 66
challenges.description: U.S. Route 66 or U.S. Highway 66 was one of the original highways in the United States Numbered Highway System. It was established on November 11, 1926

challenges.title: Equator
challenges.description: The equator is a circle of latitude that divides Earth, into the northern and southern hemispheres. It is an imaginary line located at 0 degrees latitude, halfway between the North and South poles.

challenges.title: River Nile
challenges.description: The Nile is a major north-flowing river in northeastern Africa. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea. The Nile is the longest river in Africa and has historically been considered the longest river in the world.
